Help:Node.title: General Concepts: Movement
Help:Node.Log:Description:
Title: Movement
Important Commands: down, e, enter, n, s, up, w
Syntax: "$(udat.chatchar)north", "$(udat.chatchar)n", "$(udat.chatchar)enter trapdoor", "$(udat.chatchar)down"
The easiest way to move from room-to-room in $(theatre.gamebrief) is by using compass directions. You can travel $(udat.chatchar)WEST, $(udat.chatchar)W, $(udat.chatchar)SOUTH, $(udat.chatchar)S, $(udat.chatchar)N, or $(udat.chatchar)NE, for example. It is also possible to move $(udat.chatchar)UP and $(udat.chatchar)DOWN.
There are also numerous "exit" objects in $(theatre.gamebrief): gates, doors, and trapdoors to name a few. These also allow you to move in between rooms. You can go through these by typing $(udat.chatchar)ENTER [DOORWAY]. For example: $(udat.chatchar)ENTER TRAPDOOR or $(udat.chatchar)ENTER IRON GATE.
Inside a room, you have considerable ability to move near to other objects (or people or players). The easiest way is to type $(udat.chatchar)APPROACH [OBJECT]; you can move away from an object that you've approached by typing $(udat.chatchar)LEAVE.
You can also use a variety of other verbs and prepositions to move into proximity with objects. Some examples include: $(udat.chatchar)STAND BY FILBERT, $(udat.chatchar)LIE UNDER TABLE, and $(udat.chatchar)SIT NEAR HEARTH.
See Also: Proximity, Rooms
